title: i love how there is always trending champ to hate on
body:
You remember about a month ago when every post was about how op {{champion:429}} was?
or how about 2 months ago when every post was about how op {{champion:7}} was?
my point is that some people just post hate on a champ because everyone else is. 
this doesn't mean that the champ their talking about is broken *cough* {{champion:67}}  *cough*.

I still hate kalista. 

Never thought she was OP just poorly designed.
Exactly. This is why people hate her. She is not OP, but she is terrible Champion design.

Even if she's underpowered she could still be nerfed due to how unfun it is to fight against her.

"o u actualy weree planing 2 hit thos skillshots"

I've never stopped complaining about what a horrible mistake Kalista is, LB has always been a problem, and the only reason people complain about Vayne is because every carry that bullied her in lane has been nerfed to hell - which of course means she's strong now.

I think the problem lies with two main problems:

The first one is champion designs. Certain champions are either going to just be flat out broken if they have the right numbers due to how frustrating and/or overloaded their kit is. See Yasuo, Kalista, Riven or Leblanc. If they have the right numbers, they're going to be difficult to deal with. If they don't, they're generally not going to even make be a presence in LoL. 

Usually this means their kit design is an immense problem. 

Then there are others whom become strong through virtue of how the meta is playing out. Vayne is pretty much a textbook example of this. Tanks are significantly more frequent then now then a year ago. The more tanks or high hp champions you see, the more you will see Vayne. I do think she is too strong, but there is a reason why her playing and win rate has shot up lately. When tanks fizzle out and assassins come back, you won't see a lot of Vaynes being played.

Then the cycle will shift to complaining about which ever assassin is overpowered :p
Not when assassins come back, but when they buff ADC lane bullies.
Exactly, because Vayne has one of the easiest times dealing with assassins - self peel too stronk.

I still complain about Kalista and LB, they're still annoying as all living fuck to deal with, and I've always hated Vayne as well, among a couple other champs who become the frequent focus and then don't get talked about as much for a while afterwards.

Just cause the forums do through a cycle doesn't mean no one thinks past focus' aren't still broken, OP, or just irritating.  All three of those champs you mentioned are problems, two of them just aren't played as often as the third therefore not talked about as much.

Logic, bruh.
Riven and Fizz are quite popular for the circlejerk as well. Zed had a similar amount of threads before his nerfs, and so did Lucian.
Fizz deserves every last bit of hate he gets.
And so does Riven.
And so does Zed.
At least Zed is easier to counter. 2 Items and a summ spell makes Zed really really sad. Oh and Vlad LOL Troll poll awayyyy

2 items
Summoner spell

Well, counter building is something in this game, if you dont do it you dont win, simple. And i think this is horrible champion design. Getting a Zhonya/QSS means Zed cant do his job, and since this two items are GOOD on his targets (APC and ADC) then you dont even punish them with sub-bar items.

Honeslty hating Zed is kinda dumb, the fact it's so easy to counter build it's kinda retarded when you bitch about him killing you, especially as an ADC, since the item cost 1250 G or something, and gives you MR and a good active.

I do hate, however, that he can 100-0 WITHOUT his ult tick. Just by ulting and using the dmg from the 3 shadows + Botrk+ Hydra+ AA he can kill you.... Granted that's a long combo, but still, I think he is the only assasin that can 100-0 somone without his ult.

EDIT: Oh, and the fact that the DMG from the ult IGNORES resistance, meaning you have to save your def skill for the tick not the dmg, which I think is kinda bullshit, and it's hidden iformation.

I found out about this while playing Yi against him, meditated his full combo and barely did dmg to me, then once I left meditation the tick went of and took ALL my hp, only needing a single AA to finish me off.

That's really bullshit.

Well, Vayne has gotten pretty out of hand. She's starting to get major pro usage, and is actually working. I've honestly seen her bully an opponent back to base, just from her AAs. She didn't miss a single CS as it happened, and all she had was a Doran's Blade. So maybe Vayne needs some nerfs. 

In any case, the other two you mentioned were eventually nerfed and brought back into check.

LeBlanc was nerfed a while ago and we were all happy until her recent buffs.

Everyone hates Kalista and Vayne for the same reason, ADC's with infinite self-peel are inherently toxic to play against because they can work around their only real weakness, getting caught out. Vayne honestly doesn't need a support to protect her half the time and unlike every other duelist in the game, she doesn't pay for it with garbage teamfighting because she can deal damage from range. Kalista is also a nightmare to lock down with her horribly designed passive which also makes her immune to movespeed slows, and her overloaded kit allows her to be relevant at all stages of the game.

Last Season we also had {{champion:42}} {{champion:60}} {{champion:59}} {{champion:38}} {{champion:121}} {{champion:236}} {{champion:254}} on the hate list. People just suddenly forgot they hated those champions when they got nerfed like they demanded Riot do.
Because when they get nerfed, they're not in every other game anymore stomping the enemy team. Of course they don't hate those champs as much anymore because they're not to be hated anymore.
Every single one of those champions had a period of being in the top 3 most picked for their role, last season.
lmao it's not like we forgot about them we just realize there's a larger shit pile then we originally thought

Vayne hatred has been around for a while now.

The only one that applies to the trending hatred is the Kalista. It was pretty hot for a while a few months ago, and now she's barely mentioned again. 

Leblanc threads have left because the meta has shifted, and she was nerfed. If they ever decide to buff her, I assume we'll see those threads again.
That's because as the meta changes, some champion gets an unfair advantage.

Usually this is true.. but the hate on Vayne is at a very random time. Vayne is known for being good vs tanks given her W. However, it wasn't until after the cinderhulk meta that people complained about Vayne. 

I do feel that Vaynes W needs to be changed to only % dmg and have the flat damage removed.. But the timing of which people are crying about Vayne is laughable.

The thing is, during the majority of the meta, you had viable counters to Vayne to keep her in check. However, all of those counters have been nerfed to the point of not countering her anymore. That is why you didn't see the Vayne hate until now.

I believe that if there are champions made powerful by the meta, then they should be balanced out according the the meta. But those select few who continue to be complained about even after metas move forward (ie: Vanye and Riven) then THOSE are the ones to truly worry about.

She only needs 3 buffs

A) Incresse second Q range. They reduced the cone but didnt buff the range to compensate. Her Q hits harder, but its really hard to hit, because it's not an ordinary skill shot, it relies on minion positioning and HP, something that makes it really obvious on when you are going to use it and sometimes they move with you expecting it, resulting in a missed Q and you raging.

C) Make her ult deal real dmg late game. I'm a sitting duck while chananilg this ability, at least make it worth while. You end up using this skill to scare people and make them disengage, or to finish up that one guy who mannaged to run away with 10 HP. It's scaling are weird, they also need to fix that. I know that mix dmg is supposed to be a good thing because its harder to itimize agaist it, but it's also harder to itimize FOR it. I'll much rather have the AD scalling dealing Physical dmg and the AP scalling dealing Magic dmg, because to be honest, we are not corky, or magic dmg is a joke.

We have an acronym for those champions.

FotM - Flavor of the Month

Basically, it's a champion that's popular due to the current meta, and they become a popular complaint target as a result.

Fun fact, I still strongly dislike all of those champions, and that has never changed.

Vayne because she is _**safe**_ and hyper mobile, combined with %max health true damage which cannot be effectively itemized against.  My dislike for her is only more-so because the items that actually were good against her have been nerfed, which only annoys me further.

LeBlanc because she is **_safe_** and hyper mobile, combined with incredibly massive burst and very high snowball potential.  I don't mind her as much because actually carrying games with her is difficult (she suffers harshly in teamfights) but that doesn't change the fact that I significantly dislike her.

Kalista should never have existed.  Period.  That champion is the absolute culmination of mobility creep and safety combined.  Granting an ADC strong DPS, free vision tools, insane amounts of free mobility, and _hard CC_ on top of that, and you have a broken champion.
